inn1.comm: Some outswing to start proceedings on a overcast day. It started from the middle, curved out and Bell got right behind the line to push it to the onside of the pitch.
starts from outside off stump and moving away, left alone by Bell.
fuller, Bell is drawn forward, thinks about playing a shot before he watches the swing and lets it go past him
lands outside off stump and swings away, left alone. Bell then has a close look at where it landed, shakes his head and moves to the leg side.
further outside off stump and shaping away, easy decision to let that go through to Boucher.
on the middle stump line, moving away a touch, Bell shuffles in to line, tucks it to right side of mid-on for a single.
The usual Ntini angle to start off with - Coming in from outside off stump, Bell takes a very positive stride out to defend back to the bowler.
lands outside off stump, comes in but not enough to pose any danger to the off stump and Bell shoulders arms
Bell is moving towards the off stump even as Ntini is about to deliver, covers the sticks and lets this one go past him
a tad fuller, just outside off stump, nips back in and Bell is right behind the line to tap to the off side
lands further outside off stump and stays there. Bell leaves it alone, then suggests he should have square driven it.
Deja-vu. Outside off and no shot offered.
The first ball that came in from Steyn. From short of length and Prior pushes it to the on side.
this one curves away and Prior is almost sucked into playing before he has a change of mind. A touch too short in length, though.
again short in length, coming in this time and Prior is on the move, gets behind the line to push it to the on side of the pitch.
slips towards the pads, fails to connect with the glance but will pick up a leg bye as the white ball rolls down to fine leg. Bell re marks his guard.

Gorgeous straight drive. Orgas....!  Full pitched delivery, shaping away a touch around the off stump line, Bell leaned forward, covered the swing and creamed it straight down the ground. Lovely swing of the bat and wonderful timing. Great to watch.
Ah! that expected short-pitched one and Bell is ready, alert and pulls it away without any fuss.
Prior gets into act. Fullish and outside off stump, Prior takes a tiny step forward and drives it through wide mid-off region. Too full on that occasion.
beaten by a peach of a delivery. It landed on a length, drifting in with the Ntini angle before it shaped away a touch and Prior is beaten comprehensively, pushing inside the line.

And again. A loud shout for a caught-behind decision. It went off the back thigh, though. Quite similar to the previous delivery, instead of shaping away it held its line and Prior was squared up completely and the ball rushed past the outside edge, brushed the back thigh and went to Boucher
another one holding its line outside off, Prior has a stab at it before getting his bat out of the way. Free hit coming up.
Prior moves outside leg stump, has a wild swing and gets a profitable thick edge just over the first slip. What's more, another free hit coming up. Ntini marks his run up again.

Similar approach from Prior - Moves outside leg stump. Different approach from Ntini- tries to follow Prior but slips down leg side. And interestingly,  Ntini released this delivery from the stumps, didn't approach anywhere close to the popping crease.

Wallop! Prior moved outside leg stump, Ntini pinged the stumps, a bit slower than normal but Prior picked it up, waited a touch before blasting it over mid-on region. Up, up and over. 13 off one ball in effect...good effort from Prior, says Gnasher. Ntini played his part in that as well.
beaten outside off stump. It landed on a good length around off stump and straightened, Prior, perhaps exhausted with all the activity on the free hit orgy, pushed weakly inside the line
short in length, pushed of  the back foot to the on side
lands back of length, comes in towards middle stump, Bell tries to work it to the on side, misses and is hit high on the pad
fuller, trying to get a lbw decision but slips on the legs and Bell is very good there. A gentle roll of the wrists and the ball speeds to the fine-leg boundary.
That is a cracker of a delivery. It landed on a length around off stump and moved away a bit. To be fair to Bell, he didn't chase it but just pushed inside the line.
leans forward to defend down the track.

in the channel outside off stump, Bell shoulders arms. And now signals to the dressing room to get him a fresh pair of gloves. Try that in the club games and you get abuses from the 12th man when he eventually arrives after finishing his cigarette.
similar to the previous delivery and Bell has no change of mind. Left alone again.
outside off stump, holding its line, Prior tries to force it through the off side, misses and Boucher collects.
a little awkward dance down the track and towards the off stump, tries to work the short-of-length delivery to the on side, misses and the ball flies over the leg stump
fuller, straighter on the middle stump line, mistimes the on drive to mid-on
Ntini serves rubbish from wide of the crease - short and well outside off stump and Prior hops back to punch it through cover point. Full follow-through of the bat, ending up behind his head.
a touch slower, on the stumps, leans forward to defend down the track
full and in the tempting zone outside off stump, a touch wide and Bell lets that one alone. He then suggests he should have blasted it through covers.
On a track and in conditions aiding swing and movement, SA bowlers are serving quite a lot of rubbish. This one is full and on the legs, Bell plays a lovely pick-up shot over square leg.
banged in short and outside off stump, Bell goes for the pull but can't quite get on top of the bounce, the bat-face shuts and the ball rolls to the on side
Wide down the leg side this time and Boucher makes a diving stop.

Flamboyant pick-up over midwicket. Really good-looking stroke. Full in length and drifting towards middle and leg, Bell leaned forward, got his bottom-hand working over time and chipped it high over the infield.
couple of steps down the track and he checks his punch-drive and the ball goes in the air but falls well short of any fielder and rushes through the gap between midwicket and mid-on.
shoulder-high bouncer on the off stump line, swayed away.
full in length and well outside off stump, coming, Bell reaches out and gets a thick outside edge past the first slip
gets behind the line of a length delivery, defends with soft hands. Too soft as the ball spins back and bounces over the stumps. Bell had swiveled back to prevent it from hitting the stumps
The agony continues, if you are a South African ie. Length delivery outside off stump and Bell opens the bat-face to dab it to third man and it runs between the 'keeper and the wide first slip
More joy for the English. Short-pitched delivery and Bell spanks it over midwicket. The runs are coming in a flood.
Full and well outside off stump, left alone
outswinger, shaped to off drive and is beaten

skips down the track, across towards the off stump and square drives through cover point. No violence. He didn't charge down the track but just sort of eased to the pitch of the delivery with twinkling footwork
cut back in sharply, tried to defend on the front foot and is cut into half as the ball thuds in the waist
beaten by some late movement, trying to defend
fuller, outside off stump, shapes to drive but edges it to the on side
swinging into Prior and there's a huge appeal from Ntini, but it's going over the top on height alone. That appeal was angry, raucous and spirited
pushed out to cover
oh, what a shot. Takes a step down the pitch, opening up his stance, and creams this through extra cover. Wonderfully struck
brilliant! In the slot, and Bell just swings his arms and clonks it over the top for six. Nothing wrong with the delivery, really - perhaps a little wide, but it was just a fine shot
fifty for Bell as he cuts another four. This is pretty disappointing bowling by Ntini, dropping this short and wide, and Bell cuts it firmly past point. Class, power...both in sync here
defended on the back foot
ooh, that's a brute from Morkel! It bounces nastily on Prior who tries to get out of the way but fends it ... over the slips for four
defended on the back foot
excellent line this time. Prior's solid in defence
swinging into the batsman who tries to time this through the covers, but it holds up on the pitch a touch. They steal a single
blocked off the back foot. Good comeback from Morkel
an inside edge just past the stumps. Prior's alert, and he demands Bell through for a single
right on target - on and around the off stump, shaping in, Bell has a tentative poke and edges it behind square leg
What was that?! Way down the leg side. Poor fellow crashed his right hand with the stumps, trying to get as close as possible and has hurt his hand.
gets on the back foot to defend a back-of-length delivery to the on side
full in length, 82.8 mph, just outside the off stump and Prior pushes it to the off side

kicking up from a length outside off stump, Prior is caught at the crease- neither forward or back - jabs at it, taking the bottom-hand off the handle and the ball rolls to the off side. Good over so far.
produces the edge with a very full delivery on the off stump line but it rolls past the solitary wide slip.
Another full delivery, on the middle, trying for the lbw but Prior arrests his front-foot movement, gets his bat across to turn it past square leg
92.9 mph full pitched delivery outside off stump and Bell lets it fly past him before doing some gardening down the track
Bell continues to chug along merrily. He leaned forward to knife a 89 mph length delivery on the up and between the bowler and mid-off. Strike rate of 133.3.
fullish on the middle stump line, turned neatly past square leg for another couple of runs
89.2 mph short-of-length delivery angling towards the off stump, Bell gets forward, head over the ball and defends compactly to the off side. Two slips watch with interest.
89.5 mph bouncing delivery around the rib cage, Bell twists his body to tuck the ball behind square leg.
90.6 mph full delivery on the off stump line, Prior is late in getting forward, lunges out to push it towards mid-on.
on the stumps off a length and Bell pushes it down the track. No slip in.
81.7 mph full-length delivery outside off stump, Bell stays back, opens the bat-face to guide it to backward point
full in length, outside off stump, Bell gets forward to defend. Again does a bit of gardening. You guys do that? Tap on the turf like international batsman, without knowing why you are doing it?!
short of length delivery and Bell walks down the track tp push it away but Amla intercepts at point.
leans forward to push a full length delivery to point where AB de Villiers stops and has a shy at the non-striker's end. He misses but a diving Prior would have been home even if he had hit.
a touch wide outside off stump and that allows Bell to run it down to third man.
well outside off stump, full as well, Bell reaches out, tries to slice it away but gets a bottom edge and the ball rolls through to Boucher.
cutting in towards the middle stump, Bell lunged forward, bat ahead of the body and edged it past the leg stump
he is trying to make room by backing away a touch but goes hard at the on-the-up drive and mistimes it to the off side
Hello?! Bell must be getting bored. He walks across outside the off stump, so far across that he can't get bat to a short-of-length delivery bouncing over the middle stump.
banged in short and it climbs high over the off stump. What does Bell do? He hops and tries his best to get bat to the ball but fails.
slower one, full and straight and Bell pushes it to the off side. Another tight over
100 up with a flick to long leg
Albie gets the breakthrough. A fast and high bouncer, Prior is late on the pull and edges it towards short cover. Gibbs comes rushing in to take the catch and dives post the event.
full in length, outside off stump, lets that one go through to Boucher
gets on to the back foot to defend but will get off the mark as the ball rolls off the edge to fine leg
slips down leg side, Bell misses the glance, Boucher fails to collect cleanly. Where is Bill Lawry I say
around 81 mph bouncer and it keeps climbing. Past Shah and above the leaping Boucher.
83.8 mph length delivery outside off stump and Shah pulls his bat inside the line in a rather exaggerated manner.
in the channel outside off stump and Bell lets Boucher come into play
fuller and straighter, Bell leans forward to jab it to the off side
cutting in from short of length with bounce, Bell tucks it to the on side.
The brothers are doing a fine job here. The run-rate has come down steadily. A short-pitched delivery outside off stump and Bell goes for the cut but the ball flies over the blade.
pitches this one fuller and gets it to cut back in, turned to midwicket. Maiden over.
The last five overs yielded 20 runs for one wicket but Shah breaks free of the shackles with a flamboyant off drive through wide mid-off. A step forward and the good clean swing of the bat.
gets behind the line of a length delivery on the middle and defends to the on side
Both brothers have used quite a few short-pitched deliveries to keep the batsmen guessing. This one climbed shoulder-high and Shah hops to keep it down in front of him
slight shuffle across and places a fuller delivery to left of mid-on
And they punctuate the shorter ones with slower ones. But this one goes down the leg side.
Bell skips down the track, moving outside leg in the process and punches the short-of-length delivery on the middle straight to Duminy at covers
leans forward to tap a 84.1 mph full-length delivery towards mid-off and runs with the stroke
Full pitched on the middle, driven back past the bowler and Ntini moves to his left to make a diving half-stop
short in length and outside off, left alone
cutting in towards the middle, nudged past square leg
short delivery, comes forward to cut it but can't beat covers
short of length, dabbed to third man
kicks up from short of length, on the middle, clears the front foot and goes for the big slog over midwicket but can't get any wood on leather
leans forward to defend
The slower one  goes awry. Wide down the leg side.
But he persists with another slower one, on the middle and leg, Bell waits before flicking it past square leg for a single
Short and outside off stump, Shah arrested the front-foot movement, swivelled back to flay it with a pull over wide midwicket
fuller and on the middle stump line, leans forward to defend to the on side
83.4 mph length delivery on the middle, coming in a touch and Shah leans forward to defend down the track
he stands with his bat raised stumps height , shuffles a touch and lets a length delivery whizz past the off stump
the last ball of the powerplays - length delivery homing in on the off stump -  is carefully defended to the off side
floated outside off stump, turns in slightly, Bell goes back to tuck it behind square leg
outside off stump, Shah plays for the non-existent spin and edges it to short third man
flatter, on the off stump line, punched to covers
slower, outside off stump, Shah is made to wait and he works it to midwicket
quicker, almost a yorker, stabbed to short third man
leans across to square drive through cover point for a single
short in length and cut away for a single
opens the bat face to guide to third man for a single
in the channel outside off stump, shapes to play before pulling his bat away in his unique fashion
gets close to the line of a length delivery to run it down to third man
slightly short in length, pulled to long leg
leans forward to on drive a flighted delivery to wide long-off region for couple of runs
turns to the leg side of a run
leans forward to flick the flighted delivery to the on side and gets a leading edge along the ground back to the bowler
gets off the strike with a dab through cover point
flatter, on the middle and off line, slight turn, worked to wide midwicket  where AB de Villiers fails to pick up the ball.
full and just outside off stump, eased to long-off
short in length, just outside off stump, punched on the up but straight to covers
banged in short and outside off stump and Shah pulls it through wide midwicket region.
fuller, on a length and Shah defends down the track
here comes the slower one, full and on the middle and Shah works it to midwicket
run out chance missed. It was pushed close on the off side and off they went. de Villiers came rushing in from backward point, swooped on the ball and under-armed a throw but missed the stumps.
pretty full and straight, on the middle, dug out to the on side
leans forward to ease a delivery on the off stump line to long-on for a single

Trapped in front by a quicker one. It was pushed through quicker, landed around middle and moved towards middle and leg, Bell goes back, sees the pace, is alarmed, tries to bring his bat down in a hurry but goes across the line, misses and is caught right in front. Simon Taufel reckons, rightly, it would have hit the leg stump
leans forward to defend down the track
quicker, flatter, on the middle and off, worked past square leg by the England captain
leans across to guide to backward point
leans forward to work to right of midwicket
and he's bowled him! A thick inside edge by Shah, coming forward to a straight delivery, and he was a little late on it
left alone outside off
not a bad way to get off the mark! Outside off, Flintoff lunges forward and check-drives this elegantly for four. Nothing more than a push through extra cover
solidly defended off the back foot
very wide but Flintoff can only toe-end this to short extra cover
very well bowled by Kallis, almost squaring up Flintoff who was forced into a late change of stroke on the back foot
Pietersen skips down the pitch and clips it to long-on for a single
Flintoff's forward, defending this firmly
half a shimmy down the pitch before he defends this straight delivery
defended on the back foot
punched to long-on off the back foot for a single
again flicked to long-on
short in length and outside off stump, KP stands tall on the back foot to punch it square of deep point for couple of runs

KP is gone.  It landed outside off stump on a length and came in, KP thrust his front foot and tried to whip it across the line, missed and was struck on the back leg just about on the line on the off stump. SA have come back well after the roaring start made by Bell and Prior
full and straight, worked to the on side
leans forward to defend a length delivery to the off side
cutting in from outside off and Collingwood leans forward to defend with the full face of the bat
shuffles across to push a length delivery to covers
stretches well forward to defend to covers
lunges out to on drive but de Villiers, at short and straightish midwicket, dives to prevent the single
floated on the off stump, driven back down the track
leans forward to work a flighted delivery to short midwicket
flatter, quicker outside off stump, Flintoff goes back to dab it to backward point
gets the first run of the over with a drive to long-on
full in length, moving in from about the off stump line, Flintoff stays back to defend it to the off side
gets forward this time and defends to covers
80.9 mph full-length delivery just outside off stump, Flintoff shapes to off drive and edges it behind square leg
83.3 mph length delivery coming in as ever and Collingwood gets behind the line to work it to the leg side
fuller, outside off stump, pushed to covers.
80.7 mph cutting in towards the middle stump line, Collingwood tucks it behind square leg
floated outside off stump, driven to the left of the bowler who makes a valiant attempt to stop it but can't prevent the ball from running to long-off
slower, bit more air, outside off stump, driven to covers
couple of steps down and across towards the off stump, gets outside the line of a flighted delivery on the off and middle line and whips it to deep midwicket region
nice teasing flighted delivery outside off, inviting the drive against the turn and Flintoff eases it to long-off
full and on the off stump, wristed down to long-on
on the middle and leg, slower and Flintoff is early into the flick and it runs off the pad to the leg side
a tad slower in pace, outside off stump line, Collingwood is made to wait on the front foot and he steers the ball to backward point
fuller, outside off stump, punched down the ground, Kallis gets his left hand out to deflect the ball to covers
shorter in length, pushed to the off side. Again no run. Flintoff comes across to have a chat with Collingwood.
slips in a slower one, full and just outside the off stump, Collingwood leans forward to defend.
fuller, lands past the popping crease but a tad wide and that allows Collingwood to steer it past backward point for couple of runs
drifting towards middle and leg, full, flicked to long leg
flighted on the middle and leg, nurdled behind square leg for a run
slower, bit more air and pushed to the on side of the pitch and Botha intercepts
from slightly wide of the crease, on the middle stump line, worked past square leg
flatter, coming into the middle and off line, punched to short midwicket
comes down the track, takes it on full and taps it down to long-on for a single
quicker, on the middle stump line, Flintoff gets forward to work it past midwicket for a single
walks down the track. reaches the pitch of a length delivery and lofts it over mid-on
full in length, pushed to midwicket
outside the off stump, steers it to third man for a single
outside the off stump and coming in a touch, pushes it to midwicket and stays put
intent this time as Colly comes down the track and drags it over midwicket for a resounding boundary
leans forward to defend a length delivery down the track
leans across to push a full delivery to cover point for a single

The wickets continue to fall. It spun in towards the middle and leg line, Collingwood tried to work it to the on side for a single and must have got a itsy bitsy teeny weeny edge on to the pad and it popped up to Boucher. Taufel has no doubt.
shuffles to the off side and flicks the off break to square leg
flighted outside off stump, worked with the turn to backward square leg for his first run in international cricket
full and dug out back to the bowler
full again, this time Flintoff holds his balance to drive to long-off
from wide of the crease, full in length, angling towards off stump, defended on the front foot
drifting in full and on the middle and leg, flicked to long leg for a single
he has this habit of shuffling across, fails to connect with the glance and the ball rushes past the leg stump
again that slight shuffle across and drives on a bent knee to mid-off.
on the middle stump, that shuffle allows him to get very close to the line and he wrists the ball past square leg for a single
gets on the front foot to defend a delivery coming in off a length to backward point
outside off stump, a touch short in length and Flintoff runs it down to third man to retain the strike.
pretty full around the off stump, square driven to deep point region
leans across to whip to deep midwicket
slower, turning in, Flintoff waits before tapping it past square leg
shuffles across before backing to the leg side to create room and cuts a short -of-length delivery to deep cover
flatter, fuller around off stump, Flintoff stretches forward to defend
low dipping full toss, Flintoff takes his time to get the placement right and drives well to the left of long-off where Albie puts in a diving effort but ends up deflecting the ball over the ropes
full and on the off and middle line, squeezed to point
on the middle stump line, coming in with the Ntini angle, worked to short midwicket
outside off stump, punched on the up to Amla at sweeper cover
He killed that one. Couple of steps down the track and knifed the short-of-length delivery outside off on the up and to the deep extra cover boundary.
turns this one to fine leg for a single
82.2 mph delivery cutting in towards middle stump, defended to the on side.
on a length, around the middle stump, squared up a touch and he jabs the ball to the on side of the pitch.
dug in short, at the body, Flintoff stands tall to clip it behind square leg
way down the leg side, Taufel extends his arms. 18 extras so far.
straighter, on the middle, full in length, nudged to the on side
86 mph sharp bouncer on the middle stump line, Samit Patel's shuffle takes him right in front of the bouncer and he manages to sway away at the last minute.
follows the bouncer with a full-pitched delivery around off stump, eased to wide mid-off
just outside off stump, holding its line if any thing and Flintoff steers it past backward point
fullish, on the middle and leg, flicked to deep square leg region
banged in short, around the off stump line, Flintoff is late on the pull and edges it high in the air but lands in the unmanned wide long-on region
pushes it through the off side field for a single
short in length, cutting in towards the off and middle, shuffles across to turn it to midwicket
short in length and width offered outside off, forced away to right and wide of the third man fielder Duminy

His first international boundary. Does it in style too.  He shuffled across, the ball was banged in short and came in towards his right shoulder, he lifted his left leg in the air and lapped the ball to deep backward square leg boundary.
Extra no 19. Typical Morne wide down the leg side.
straighter, pushed past the bolwer and the mid-off fielder comes around to stop it
fuller, on the middle stump, Patel flicks the 90mph delivery to deep midwicket
lifting delivery on the middle, Flintoff stands tall, gets on top of the bounce and keeps the ball down in front of him
beaten by the slower one outside off. Flintoff was late in picking it, then tried to run it to third man but couldn't connect

Ouch. Flintoff is hit on the helmet. It was a well-directed bouncer coming in at his face, he took his eyes off, went for the pull, missed and was hit  flush on the grill. The helmet is off and some drinks come out for him. The physio is out there now. He is ready now...
short in length, moving in towards the off stump, Flintoff gets behind the line to defend to the off side .
short in length, outside off stump, punched to deep point region
short in length and outside off, Flintoff punched it to the ground and it bounced over the backward point fielder. Very good timing there. Mere push.
backs to the leg side and pushes a length delivery past the bowler
outside off stump, shuffles across to play a wristy steer to backward point
slower ball,full and on the off and middle line, turned to midwicket
retains the strike with a wristy push to long-on
Inside edge to fine-leg boundary. Kallis has a wry smile. It was full in length, around off stump, Patel was neither back or forward, had a waft and got a lucky edge
leans forward to push to covers
bring the 50 of the partnership with a clip off the hips to long leg
Crash. He moved outside leg stump, Kallis served a short of length delivery on middle and leg and Flintoff fisted it past the diving backward point boundary.
takes the single of the fifth ball with a nudge to third man. He reaches the other end and has a look at the scoreboard.
the slower one on the middle, Patel wrists it past square leg
full pitched outside off stump, driven to mid-off
pushes towards mid-off again but had taken the pace of the ball with his check drive and that allows them to steal a single

50 up for Flintoff with a push to cover point. As ever, he holds the bat on the blade , around the curved area at the top, and holds it in the air to acknowledge the cheers from the crowd and his team-mates in the dressing room.
Fullish and he stayed adjacent to the line to blast it through mid--off
tucked to square leg for a single
walks down, moving outside leg in the process, is greeted by a waist-high full toss which he pushes to sweeper cover
moves outside leg stump to drive a fullish delivery on the middle but can't beat the cover fielder
that walk down the track again, backing to the leg side and drives the full delivery to long-on
yorker on the middle and off line, dug out towards extra cover for a single
drilled down the ground. He walks down the ground, takes it on the full and smashed it down the ground. Duminy with the dive but in vain
rotates the strike by pinging long-off
Patel takes the Flintoff route- walks outside leg and slices a full pitched delivery to deep backward point region for couple of runs
For a change, Flintoff walks towards the off side but ends up mistiming a drive to covers
stays where he is and biffs a full-pitched delivery to long-off. That was powerfully hit but couldn't find the placement
If you miss, I hit, as Holding says. Patel moved outside leg stump and tried to drive inside-out over covers but missed. The off stump has been pegged back. 31 from 33 and he will take that.
on the middle and leg, dabbed to square leg for a single
gets in line to drive to long-off for a single
on a length, outside off stump, steered to point
threatens to move outside leg stump, Morne pushes it outside off and Flintoff reaches out to slice it to left of third man
85.8 mph bouncer that follows Luke Wright, who had moved towards the leg side. He adjusts to fend it away to third man
clears the front foot and has a biff across the line but edged it on to his pad.
full and outside off stump, carved to deep point region
walks down the track, goes on  a bent knee to scoop a full-length delivery to wide long-off
bouncer over the middle stump line, Wright tries to upper cut it but can't connect. Three overs to go.

Simple technique from Flintoff. He moves back and across, places his left leg towards the leg stump, opens his stance and waits. This ball arrived- full and outside off and Flintoff sliced it to deep backward point boundary
leans forward to push to the off side
beaten by the slower ball. It was in the channel outside off stump, from short of length, Flintoff tried to adjust late by opening the bat-face and attempting to run it to third man but ...
goes down the track and drives to long-off
stays back, opens his stance and flat-bats a short-pitched delivery on the off stump line,  one bounce to long-on
It was the slower ball again but Freddy is not fooled this time. He cleared the front foot and murdered it over wide long-on. The white ball kept flying.
moves outside let stump to carve a full toss on a bent knee to left of deep point where Ntini makes a diving effort but lets it slip through him
I was wondering when would that leg-side wide  from Morne would arrive.  Here it is.
He thrust his left foot out, was served a short-pitched delivery and  he flayed it to midwicket boundary. Crashing pull shot.
down the track, moving outside leg in the process and slices a fullish delivery of the outer edge to third man
Ah! the improvisations continue. Flintoff moves outside off this time, lifted his left leg in the air and lapped the short delivery to fine leg boundary
again moves towards the off side, receives a fuller delivery this time but doesn't connect with his swing.
Wright decides to do whatever Flintoff does. That walk outside off and produces the flick to deep square leg region
full pitched outside off stump, run down to third man for a single
stays back to drive powerfully to long-off. Just a single, though.
Dropped by Morne at short fine leg. Wright moved outside off stump, tried to paddle a full-pitched delivery, got the top edge and Morne ran back but couldn't hold on
opens his stance by placing his left leg outside leg stump but mistimes the intended big hit across the line to midwicket
Wright falls after a breezy 17. He went for the across-the-line slog but ended up sending a dolly of a catch to midwicket.

They won't get to 300. Just five runs this over. Another big hit to the leg side doesn't' materialize and they will have to be contend with the leg bye. But a fine innings from Flintoff, a 77-ball 78, has propelled England to finish on a strong 296.

inn2.comm: right on money: in the zone outside off stump, shaping away a touch, left alone by Amla
some swing there but short in length and that allows Amla to stay back and punch it to covers
two slips watch eagerly as Amla runs down a short-of-length delivery moving away from him to third man
beaten. It curved away from back of length outside off stump and Gibbs was sucked into a forward prod. A tad fuller and he might be in business.
stays short of length, moves the ball away from Gibbs who is on the back foot, pushing it to the point region
around the off stump line, cutting away a touch from back of length, pushed to covers
short in length, moving away, guided to left of backward point where Collingwood makes a diving stop
a tad fuller and Amla gets on the front foot to defend to the off side
cuts back in - sharp movement- from short of length, moves pas the waft and runs off the thigh pad to short fine-leg region
kicks up from a length, around the off stump, Gibbs is right behind the line to defend.
full in length, homing in on the off stump, pushed down the track
in the zone outside off stump, full in length and Gibbs shoulders arms. Good tight over. five deliveries around the off stump and one cut back in sharply.

almost holed out to mid-on. Harmison couldn't get to it. It was full in length, landed on the leg stump line and curved in, Amla was shaping to play it through midwicket and the late movement saw him chipping it towards mid-on. Harmison didn't judge it properly and couldn't move ahead in time
Edged but falls short of the diving second slip. Full and around the off stump, Amla went for the off drive and got a thick edge
full and straight - he has got his length right this over - turned to midwicket
slips to the pads, tucked to long leg for a single
lands on a length, holds its line outside off stump, Amla pushes it towards covers
probing line around the off stump, bit of movement away, squeezed of the outer half of the bat to point
full in length and outside off stump, pushed to extra cover for a single
length delivery just outside off stump, Amla plays it late, pushing it to covers. Pietersen has a chat with the bowler
coming in towards middle stump line, Amla allows it to come to him before wristing it past square leg
full pitched outside off stump, dug out back to the bowler
slightly short in length and outside off stump, cut to Cook at gully.
shout for lbw as Amla falls over a touch on the front foot trying to work the nip backer to the leg side. The point of impact was perhaps outside off and the height was also in question.
full in length, worked to midwicket
short in length and outside off stump, punched through the off side and Bell rushes after it to make a sliding stop
lands back of length, moves in towards middle and leg, worked past the diving square leg
full in length, just outside the off stump, shaping in, pushed back to Anderson who threatens to throw at the striker's end but holds on to the ball
bowls the bouncer on the off stump line, Amla was arching back but went for the pull any way and in no position to play that shot and he doesn't connect.
fuller and on driven to mid-on
wristy whip across the line. It was a touch short in length and that allowed Gibbs to hop back and swat it through midwicket. Risky but that's how he plays.
full and well outside the off stump, Amla went after it but edged it to backward point
shuffles across to the off side and mistimes a drive to mid-off
full in length and outside off stump, left alone

Run out appeal, referred upstairs. It was tucked behind square leg and Samit Patel moved to his right, picked the ball up, swung around to fire a direct hit at the striker's end. Close. The bat might have just been dragged in. It's a blur actually on that particular frame and the benefit of doubt has gone to the batsman
Cracking backfoot drive through covers. Great to watch. He shifted his weight back to punch a short-of-length delivery outside off on the up and through the off-side field.
leans across to edge to third man
pushes a length delivery to the off side

The trap is set and he falls for it. Shah was placed at short cover point and guess what happened? Anderson got it to kick it up from short of length, Gibbs went back and punched it in the air and straight to Shah who swallows it.
short in length, cutting in towards the middle stump and Kallis pushes it to the on side
back of length outside off stump, tapped to left and front of backward point and they rush across for the single
the inswinger this time, full and slanting towards middle, Amla plays it late and wrists it to long leg for a single
Amla finally breaks free with a slash past point. The length - short- and the line- well outside off- allowed him to free his arms.
kicking up short of length, closer to the off stump and Amla punches it down to covers
The second boundary of the over. Amla moves towards the off stump, gets almost outside the line of a full delivery tailing in towards off and middle and flicks it very fine.
shifts his line to outside off, tapped to covers
again that walk across the sticks and Broad, more alert this time, fires in a 87mph head-high bouncer on the off stump line and Amla hops to fend it to the on side
short in length and a tad wide outside off, cut hard to right of Anderson at wide third man
full in length, just outside the off stump, driven to covers. Anderson turns back, spits as he walks to the top of his mark. No sign of Murray Mints
beaten outside off. It jumped from a short of length and held its line, Amla went for the on-the-up drive but couldn't connect
leans forward to drive to the extra cover region
86.6 mph fullish delivery outside off stump, Kallis covers his off stump and shoulders arms
full and just outside off stump, Kallis leans across to drive to covers. Nice high left elbow and a steady head position. No run, though.
slightly short in length, Kallis presses back, tries to force it through cover point but mistimes it to point
coming in towards the middle stump, pushed to left of mid-on where its deflected towards mid-off. Ping pong between the two fielders. Pietersen doesn't look too happy and screams, "C'mon!"
back of length, mistimes the punch drive  (the bat came in an angle) and will pick up a single to extra cover
leans across to play the extra-cover drive but edges it to mid-on. The ball tailed in late to get the edge.
goes back to punch to mid-off
another mistimed off drive. He leans well across to drive but is not able to middle 'em properly

his right leg first moves towards leg side before he walks towards the off stump and in all this movement he is unable to get any power behind the punch drive and the ball rolls back to the bowler who has a shy at the striker's end
swing and a miss. Full and in the zone outside off, Amla didn't move towards the line, had a big swing but ...
closer to the off stump, full, driven crisply to right of point where Shah makes a diving stop
cutting in towards off and middle from short of length, Amla stays adjacent to the line to dab it left of backward point
testing line around the off stump, full in length, Kallis gets across to defend to point
walks towards the off stump and whips a full pitched delivery on the middle but can't beat midwicket. That was well timed but he couldn't get the placement right
short in length, on the off and middle line, Kallis tries to stay adjacent to the line and steal a single like Amla did earlier but pushes it straight to backward point

Amla walks right across the sticks and whips a fullish delivery on the off stump line through wide midwicket region. The bowling has been pretty tight and the batsmen are trying to create room by moving around
another mistimed off drive from Kallis. He seems a touch late on these shots. He had walked across the stumps, ending on the off stump line.
banged in short and outside off, Amla tries to upper cut it but can't connect
That walk to outside-off again, he started it too early and that allowed the bowler to fire in a bouncer over his head and Amla ducked
They keep walking. I know Amla doesn't like to sponsor in liquor ads, else Johnny Walker would be ringing him rightaway. But he ends up mistiming the punch drive to the off side
retains the strike with a conventional dab to third man
climbing outside off stump, from short of length, Amla goes for the square cut but flashes under the ball
fuller and slipping towards middle and leg and Amla loves 'em there. He brings his wrists into play and pings the gap between midwicket and mid-on
slower one outside off stump, Amla misses the dab to third man and Prior is up too early as the ball bounces in front and spins in to beat him
leans across to defend to covers
tired of walking towards off, Kallis moves outside leg but Anderson follows him and Kallis can only push it to wards mid-on
outside off stump line, another last-ball single down to third man.
And Amla moves outside off stump but can't time his whip properly and the ball rolls to the on side
lifting delivery around the off stump, Amla didn't walk across this time, arched back and upper cut it in the air and Anderson rushes to his left at third man but can't reach it
Amla reverts to his walk to the off side and flicks a fullish delivery from the off and middle to long leg
almost a yorker on the off stump line, stabbed to cover point
short in length, moving in towards off and middle, pushed to extra cover
Shot. It was full in length and around the off stump, Kallis took a short step forward, left shoulder facing extracover and drove it on the up and through covers.
Edged but well to the right of the diving Prior. It was short and well outside off, Amla lashed it and Prior took off but couldn't reach. No slip.
He is picking lots of runs with that movement to the off side. He got outside the line of a short-of-length delivery on the off and middle and chipped it over midwicket
shifts his line to outside off and Amla dabs it to third man

Kallis also walks towards off side but is unable to get any power or placement and the ball rolls to the on side. Unlike Amla's move towards off side, Kallis' first move is to act as if he is moving to the leg side before he walks across and that tiny fraction of a second delay is hurting him
pushed to covers
again that initial movement towards legside before he presses towards off and by the time the ball is on him and he can only push it back down the track
full in length, just outside the off stump line, driven to covers
shuffles across, ends up outside off stump but Harmison keeps this outside-off and Amla edges it to his pad
he stays at his original position, Harmison fires it on the off and middle, flashed hard but straight to backward point

Amla walks. This time to the pavilion. It was a back-of-length delivery in the off stump zone and Amla stayed adjacent to the line and tried to force it on the up through the off side but got a thin inside edge and Prior took a tumbling catch.
cutting in from outside off stump, de Villiers pushes at it and edges it on to his pad
full and outside off stump, left alone
moving in towards the hips, Kallis is caught in a tangle, gets his bottom-hand of the handle and tries to poke it away and will get a leg bye
85.8 mph probing teasing delivery, jumping off a length and holding its line outside off stump. AB was caught on the shuffle and ended up pushing inside the line
cuts back in this time and is pushed to the on side
cutting in with bounce, fended to the square leg region for a single
rising delivery outside off stump, Kallis tries to upper cut it on a bent knee but can't connect. No slip in for Kallis.

moving in towards the rib cage, Kallis tries to pull, is in a tangle, the bottom-hand comes off the handle and the ball is jabbed to left of Prior, who takes the gloves off and has a shy at the striker's end as the duo scamper across for a single
Kallis continues to struggle. In the zone outside off stump, Kallis crouches to cut but is beaten. Late on the shot again.
another mistimed and edged off drive from Kallis. He shuffled across and went for the drive but edged it behind square leg.
full in length, homing in on the off stump, defended bat and pad close together to the off side
de Villiers now walks across the stumps, gets outside off and square drives a full pitched delivery through the off-side field.
full delivery outside off, driven pleasingly but straight to mid-off
the slower yorker, the Harmison special, just short of the blockhole and is turned to wide midwicket region
short and climbing, mistimes a pull shot to backward square leg

Kallis' misery ends. It was banged in short and outside off stump and Kallis went for the pull - again too late on it - and top edged it over midwicket. Samit Patel rushed back to take a good catch over his shoulder.
86.5 mph delivery cutting in from outside off stump, with bounce and de Villiers stabs it to the on side
moves towards the off stump to tickle a full delivery to square leg
goes back and across to squeeze a length delivery angling away from him to backward point
on the hips, tucked to square leg
lands outside off stump, cuts in, left alone
shuffles across to defend a length delivery to the off side
tailing in from outside off stump, stretches forward to defend to the on side
Ouch. It cut back in sharply from outside off, cut de Villiers into half and crashed into the inner thigh. de Villiers is in pain.
walks outside off stump, Harmison pushes it further outside and is left alone
sharp and well-directed bouncer on the middle, de Villiers took his eyes off the ball but went through with his pull and picks up a single to long leg
just outside the off stump, de Villiers was moving towards, is cramped as the ball cuts back in and pushes it to the cover region
87.2 mph delivery, bouncing from short of length and de Villiers gets off the ground to get on top of the bounce and steers it to point
moves towards the off stump again - The SA batsman are sticking to this plan- Flintoff fires in a bouncer outside off and de Villiers can't connect with the pull
short in length and outside off stump, punched to deep cover where Samit Patel fumbles.

Suicidal run and de Villiers is run out. It was turned towards long leg and he turned blind for the second run that was never there. Harmison with the accurate  throw and Prior breaks the stumps with de Villiers no where in sight. SA are tottering on the edge here.
on the hips, clipped behind square leg for a single
full in length, on the middle stump line, worked right of midwicket for a single
leans forward to turn a short-of-length delivery to point
lands outside leg stump, moves in towards the hips, clipped to deep square leg region. The throw from Anderson ricochets of the stumps at the striker's end and they take the extra run
moves in from outside leg stump, defended to the on side
short in length, outside off stump, defended to the off side
back of length, outside off stump, steered to point
short and pulled through midwicket for couple of runs
a tad fuller, outside off stump, defended to the off side
fullpitched on the middle stump line,driven to mid-on.
in the zone outside off, angling away, left alone
on a length, around the off stump, pushed of the inner half of the bat towards wide mid-on
on the middle stump line, bouncing in, Boucher twists his body to get in a position to work it past square leg
short of length, on the middle, clipped to deep square elg
leans forward to defend to covers
fuller, around off and driven to mid-off
goes back to run down to third man for a single
just outside off stump, shaping in off a length, defended to midwicket region. The game is meandering a touch
kicking up from short of length, outside off stump, Boucher is unable to get on top of the bounce and edges the punch to the leg side
floated outside off, driven back to the bowler
slower, lands outside off, turns in to beat the prod and strikes the pad outside off
fuller and outside off, Duminy goes for the sweep but misses
leans across to clip to midwicket
full and outside off stump, tries to turn it to the on side, misses and is hit on the pad outside off
outside the off stump, turns in to hit the pad and bob away to the leg side. Good tight start and Pietersen rushes to congratulate Patel and has a chat with him
shout for lbw but sliding down leg side. It was full, landed on the middle and off and slid in towards leg. Boucher tried to work it across the line and missed.
outside off stump, punched to covers
leans forward to drive the full length delivery to mid-off where Harmison makes a diving stop
how did that miss the stumps. Collingwood bowled a fast off break, it landed outside off, gripped the surface before it broke back in to beat the waft and went over middle and leg
leans forward to drive past the bowler
another fast off break but a touch short in length, dabbed to third man
skips down the track, moves outside off to reach the pitch of the delivery and on drives to long-on
almost gave a return catch. It was a slower through the air, landed on a length and stopped a touch, Boucher checked his drive and the ball fell short of the bowler
leans forward to drive back down the track
shout for lbw but the umpire reckons it's going down leg. It landed around middle and leg, slid on to beat the defensive prod and struck him in front of leg
worked to square leg for a single
fullish, on the middle and leg, driven to long-on
on the middle stump line, works it through midwicket. 194 to win from 136 balls
moves outside leg stump, hits the short of length and stops on the batsman, tapped to wide mid-off region
fuller in length, on the off stump line, turned to the on side
full and on the middle stump line, Boucher is early into his whip, checks it and the ball rolls to midwicket
short in length and Boucher laps it around the corner to deep square leg region
Boucher pulls out his slog sweep, successfully connects to deep midwicket boundary
floated on the off stump line, driven to sweeper cover region
down the track and drives to long-on. You can see the intent to go after Patel.
leans across to tap a delivery from outside off to square leg. Boucher back on strike

Boucher perishes, going for the quick runs. He moved outside leg stump pretty early and Patel slid in the arm ball on the leg stump line. Boucher went for the cut but missed it completely. South Africa continue to free fall
huge shout for lbw, turned down by Taufel. It landed just outside leg stump, turned in to hit the pad in front of the leg stump.
on a length, around off stump, steered to backward point
full and outside off stump, edged to third man region
slower one, full and outside off, driven to long-off for a single
skids on after landing around leg and middle line, jabbed to the on side
another fast off break, delivered like how Chris Cairns used to do, breaking towards off stump, tapped to the on side
flighted outside off stump, goes for the cover drive but the ball doesn't spin back in as he expected and is beaten
more carefully across this time and defends on the front foot
stretches across to defend, the ball spins back in to hit the pad, outside the off stump
this one doesn't turn in and Morkel is beaten on the cut
fuller, outside off, driven to covers
lands on the rough outside off stump and Morkel stretches across to defend
full and on the middle and leg line, turned to fine leg
gets on the front foot to turn a length delivery back to Collingwood
full in length and outside off, seam-up delivery, driven past the diving short cover (Pietersen) for a single
drags this short of length and Duminy fetches it from outside off and pulls it to Flintoff at deep midwicket
leans across to push a length delivery to cover point
on the off stump line, goes back to guide to backward point
Albie decides to free his arms. Down on his knee and a clean swing across the line and over deep midwicket
leans forward to push it back to Patel
Monster hit. He charged down the track, got to the pitch of the ball and killed it high over long-on.

what a comeback. Albie leaned forward to drive, Patel got the ball to dip and it turned in from the rough. Albie's push-drive took the ball to the right of Patel who took it inches of the turf. He just about managed to cup his palm under the ball. Very good catch. A smiling Pietersen had signalled him to calm down after that six.
shout for lbw but turned down. It landed outside off stump, from round the stumps this time, he missed the sweep and was struck outside the off stump
fuller on the middle stump, driven to long-on
fullish, on the middle and leg, turned to midwicket
slipping down leg side, glanced to the boundary.
full in length outside off stump, punched to deep point and they run hard to come back for the second run to beat the throw from Anderson
hits the deck short of length from round the stumps and the left-handed Duminy hops to defend it down the track
Wicket no 7. Flintoff's round-the-stumps angle works. It drifted in, landed on a length and shaped away, Duminy was sucked into the drive but could only edge it to Prior
from round the stumps, reversing away outside off stump, left alone
leans forward to defend
goes for the reverse sweep and gets a single to backward point region
flighted outside off stump, driven in the air but through vacant mid-on down to long-on
skids in with the arm ball, quick and flat, defended to the on side
slower this time, around leg stump, mistimes a sweep to short fine leg
goes down on his knee to play the slog sweep but edges it past square leg
coming in towards the hips, turned to deep midwicket region
beaten outside off stump by a lifting delivery that straightened. He managed to pull his bat in just in time.
the bouncer but down the leg side
Botha skips down the track to Flintoff and tucks the short-of-length lifter to backward square leg
short in length, coming in and he stands tall to push it to the off side
slightly short in length and outside off, pulled to deep midwicket
full and in the channel outside off stump, leans across, covers the off stump and lets Prior come into play
sweeps from the off stump to long leg
Dropped by Harmison. Brushed his finger tips. It was the top-edged sweep shot and Harmison moved to his left, tried desperately with a lunging dive but couldn't get under it.
sweeps along the ground for a single
leans forward to defend to extra cover
again tries to sweep and edges it in the air close on the off side. Prior lunges but it's too far from him
flat and quick, cut to point
full in length and  outside off stump, left alone
short in length and tad wide, mistimes the cut shot to covers
lifting delivery outside off stump, gets on his toes to tap it to backward point
fuller, outside off stump, slashed to backward point
Charges down the track - he did that against Flintoff as well - Harmison digs it in short and Botha stabs it close on the off side
overpitched outside off, driven hard to left of mid-off where Pietersen makes a diving stop
gets forward, yorks himself, jabs it on to his boot and the ball rolls to the off side
sweeps the full delivery from the off and middle to long leg
lands outside off stump, goes on straight, punched to mid-on
After firing the previous one, he flights this one outside off, Morne goes for the big lofted drive, gets more elevation than distance and gravity drags it down to long-on
leans back to push the flat and quick delivery back to the bowler
floated outside off stump, swept to deep midwicket
short in length and outside off stump, run down to third man
banged in short and it sails harmlessly outside off stump, left alone
better directed bouncer, around the off stump, swayed away
another lifting delivery, Steyn is late in getting the bat out of the way and the ball deflects of the periscope through vacant gully and down to third man
leans forward to defend to covers
short in length, coming in towards middle and leg, worked behind square leg for a single
really full in length, turned to midwicket
slower, on the middle and off, is early with the sweep shot, turns and runs off the pad
the quicker one, pushed through flat around off stump, stabbed it past first slip
full and on the middle, worked to short midwicket
on the off stump line, slight turn, pushed back to the bowler
leans forward to drive to left of long-on for couple of runs.
short in length and coming in , dabbed to gully region for a single
short and climbing outside off, tapped to backward point region
yet another short-pitched delivery from Harmison, Steyn goes for the pull but is beaten for pace
full pitched on the off stump line, driven to covers
slower one, full and outside off, driven to covers
full pitched outside off stump, mistimes a drive to mid-off

Patel takes another one with the arm ball. It skid on towards the leg stump, Botha was cramped for room, tried to swat it away, got the edge and the ball ricocheted of the left leg on to the leg stump
leans forward to defend to the off side
fuller, on the middle and leg, worked to short midwicket
England have won the series. Five-for for Samit Patel. It landed outside off stump and turned ever so slightly, Ntini went for the cut but ended up edging it.
